newsitem.title: ITALY: Olivetti Lexikon names Signorini new CEO.
newsitem.headline: Olivetti Lexikon names Signorini new CEO.

text.p: Italian office equipment company Olivetti Lexikon said on Wednesday that it had appointed Daniele Signorini as its new chief executive officer as part of changes at the group which bring in a new management team.

Signorini, 48, will move from the U.S.-based household appliance group Whirlpool, where he was vice-president of group sales with responsibility for sales in Europe. He replaces Emilio Torri who is leaving the company.

Olivetti Lexikon is one of the four companies making up the Olivetti group and in 1996 had global revenues of more than 1.8 trillion lire with around 5,000 employees. The group specialises in information technology products for the office and home such as printers, photocopiers and faxes.
Signorini's appointment coincides with the formation of a new management team in a move designed to simplify the company's operating structure and align it more closely with its markets.

Bruno Lamborghini was named chairman of Olivetti Lexikon. Lamborghini was one of four new entrants to the Olivetti board of directors in October 1996, and is also deputy chairman of another Olivetti company Olivetti Telemedia.
Olivetti said last year that it intended to partially float Olivetti Lexikon on the New York stock market later this year.
